root_text.dn16:4.25.4: Pattena pānīyaṁ ādāya yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:4.25.5: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, tathāgatassa mahiddhikatā mahānubhāvatā.
root_text.dn16:4.25.6: Idāni sā bhante nadikā cakkacchinnā parittā luḷitā āvilā sandamānā mayi upasaṅkamante acchā vippasannā anāvilā sandittha.
root_text.dn16:4.25.7: Pivatu bhagavā pānīyaṁ pivatu sugato pānīyan”ti.
root_text.dn16:4.26.1: Tena kho pana samayena pukkuso mallaputto āḷārassa kālāmassa sāvako kusinārāya pāvaṁ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti.
root_text.dn16:4.26.2: Addasā kho pukkuso mallaputto bhagavantaṁ aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle nisinnaṁ.
root_text.dn16:4.26.3: Disvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho pukkuso mallaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:4.26.4: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, santena vata, bhante, pabbajitā vihārena viharanti.
root_text.dn16:4.27.1: Bhūtapubbaṁ, bhante, āḷāro kālāmo addhānamaggappaṭipanno maggā okkamma avidūre aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.
root_text.dn16:4.27.2: Atha kho, bhante, pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ nissāya nissāya atikkamiṁsu.
root_text.dn16:4.27.3: Atha kho, bhante, aññataro puriso tassa sakaṭasatthassa piṭṭhito piṭṭhito āgacchanto yena āḷāro kālāmo tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āḷāraṁ kālāmaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:4.27.12: ‘So tvaṁ, bhante, saññī samāno jāgaro pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni nissāya nissāya atikkantāni neva addasa, na pana saddaṁ assosi;
root_text.dn16:4.27.13: apisu te, bhante, saṅghāṭi rajena okiṇṇā’ti?
root_text.dn16:4.27.15: Atha kho, bhante, tassa purisassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn16:4.27.16: ‘acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, santena vata bho pabbajitā vihārena viharanti.
root_text.dn16:4.27.17: Yatra hi nāma saññī samāno jāgaro pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni nissāya nissāya atikkantāni neva dakkhati, na pana saddaṁ sossatī’ti.
root_text.dn16:4.27.18: Āḷāre kālāme uḷāraṁ pasādaṁ pavedetvā pakkāmī”ti.
root_text.dn16:4.28.2: katamaṁ nu kho dukkarataraṁ vā durabhisambhavataraṁ vā—
root_text.dn16:4.28.3: yo vā saññī samāno jāgaro pañcamattāni sakaṭasatāni nissāya nissāya atikkantāni neva passeyya, na pana saddaṁ suṇeyya;
root_text.dn16:4.28.4: yo vā saññī samāno jāgaro deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā neva passeyya, na pana saddaṁ suṇeyyā”ti?
root_text.dn16:4.29.1: “Kiñhi, bhante, karissanti pañca vā sakaṭasatāni cha vā sakaṭasatāni satta vā sakaṭasatāni aṭṭha vā sakaṭasatāni nava vā sakaṭasatāni, sakaṭasahassaṁ vā sakaṭasatasahassaṁ vā.
root_text.dn16:4.29.2: Atha kho etadeva dukkaratarañceva durabhisambhavatarañca yo saññī samāno jāgaro deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā neva passeyya, na pana saddaṁ suṇeyyā”ti.
root_text.dn16:4.30.2: Tena kho pana samayena deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā avidūre bhusāgārassa dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā.
root_text.dn16:4.30.3: Atha kho, pukkusa, ātumāya mahājanakāyo nikkhamitvā yena te dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā tenupasaṅkami.
root_text.dn16:4.31.1: Tena kho panāhaṁ, pukkusa, samayena bhusāgārā nikkhamitvā bhusāgāradvāre abbhokāse caṅkamāmi.
root_text.dn16:4.31.2: Atha kho, pukkusa, aññataro puriso tamhā mahājanakāyā yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā maṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitaṁ kho ahaṁ, pukkusa, taṁ purisaṁ etadavocaṁ:
root_text.dn16:4.32.1: ‘kiṁ nu kho eso, āvuso, mahājanakāyo sannipatito’ti?
root_text.dn16:4.32.2: ‘Idāni, bhante, deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā dve kassakā bhātaro hatā cattāro ca balibaddā.
root_text.dn16:4.32.14: ‘So tvaṁ, bhante, saññī samāno jāgaro deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā neva addasa, na pana saddaṁ assosī’ti?
root_text.dn16:4.33.1: Atha kho, pukkusa, tassa purisassa etadahosi:
root_text.dn16:4.33.2: ‘acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, santena vata bho pabbajitā vihārena viharanti.
root_text.dn16:4.33.3: Yatra hi nāma saññī samāno jāgaro deve vassante deve gaḷagaḷāyante vijjullatāsu niccharantīsu asaniyā phalantiyā neva dakkhati, na pana saddaṁ sossatī’ti.
root_text.dn16:4.33.4: Mayi uḷāraṁ pasādaṁ pavedetvā maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmī”ti.
root_text.dn16:4.34.1: Evaṁ vutte, pukkuso mallaputto bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:4.34.2: “esāhaṁ, bhante, yo me āḷāre kālāme pasādo taṁ mahāvāte vā ophuṇāmi sīghasotāya vā nadiyā pavāhemi.
root_text.dn16:4.34.4: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
root_text.dn16:4.34.5: Esāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
root_text.dn16:4.34.6: Upāsakaṁ maṁ bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṁ saraṇaṁ gatan”ti.
root_text.dn16:4.35.1: Atha kho pukkuso mallaputto aññataraṁ purisaṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn16:4.35.2: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, bhaṇe, siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ āharā”ti.
root_text.dn16:4.35.3: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho so puriso pukkusassa mallaputtassa paṭissutvā taṁ siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ āhari.
root_text.dn16:4.35.4: Atha kho pukkuso mallaputto taṁ siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ bhagavato upanāmesi:
root_text.dn16:4.35.5: “idaṁ, bhante, siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ, taṁ me bhagavā paṭiggaṇhātu anukampaṁ upādāyā”ti.
root_text.dn16:4.35.6: “Tena hi, pukkusa, ekena maṁ acchādehi, ekena ānandan”ti.
root_text.dn16:4.35.7: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho pukkuso mallaputto bhagavato paṭissutvā ekena bhagavantaṁ acchādeti, ekena āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ.
root_text.dn16:4.36.1: Atha kho bhagavā pukkusaṁ mallaputtaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
root_text.dn16:4.36.2: Atha kho pukkuso mallaputto bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya sandassito samādapito samuttejito sampahaṁsito uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmi.
root_text.dn16:4.37.1: Atha kho āyasmā ānando acirapakkante pukkuse mallaputte taṁ siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ bhagavato kāyaṁ upanāmesi.
root_text.dn16:4.37.2: Taṁ bhagavato kāyaṁ upanāmitaṁ hataccikaṁ viya khāyati.
root_text.dn16:4.37.3: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:4.37.4: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, yāva parisuddho, bhante, tathāgatassa chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
root_text.dn16:4.37.5: Idaṁ, bhante, siṅgīvaṇṇaṁ yugamaṭṭhaṁ dhāraṇīyaṁ bhagavato kāyaṁ upanāmitaṁ hataccikaṁ viya khāyatī”ti.
root_text.dn16:4.37.6: “Evametaṁ, ānanda, evametaṁ, ānanda, dvīsu kālesu ativiya tathāgatassa kāyo parisuddho hoti chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
root_text.dn16:4.38.2: Yañca, ānanda, rattiṁ tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambujjhati, yañca rattiṁ anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyati.
root_text.dn16:4.38.3: Imesu kho, ānanda, dvīsu kālesu ativiya tathāgatassa kāyo parisuddho hoti chavivaṇṇo pariyodāto.
root_text.dn16:4.38.4: Ajja kho panānanda, rattiyā pacchime yāme kusinārāyaṁ upavattane mallānaṁ sālavane antarena yamakasālānaṁ tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
root_text.dn16:4.38.6: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
root_text.dn16:4.39.1: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena kakudhā nadī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā kakudhaṁ nadiṁ ajjhogāhetvā nhatvā ca pivitvā ca paccuttaritvā yena ambavanaṁ tenupasaṅkami.
root_text.dn16:4.39.3: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, cundaka, catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññapehi, kilantosmi, cundaka, nipajjissāmī”ti.
root_text.dn16:4.40.1: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā cundako bhagavato paṭissutvā catugguṇaṁ saṅghāṭiṁ paññapesi.
root_text.dn16:4.40.2: Atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṁ kappesi pāde pādaṁ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṁ manasikaritvā.
root_text.dn16:4.40.3: Āyasmā pana cundako tattheva bhagavato purato nisīdi.
root_text.dn16:4.42.1: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn16:4.42.2: “siyā kho panānanda, cundassa kammāraputtassa koci vippaṭisāraṁ uppādeyya:
root_text.dn16:4.42.3: ‘tassa te, āvuso cunda, alābhā tassa te dulladdhaṁ, yassa te tathāgato pacchimaṁ piṇḍapātaṁ paribhuñjitvā parinibbuto’ti.
root_text.dn16:4.42.4: Cundassa, ānanda, kammāraputtassa evaṁ vippaṭisāro paṭivinetabbo:
root_text.dn16:4.42.5: ‘tassa te, āvuso cunda, lābhā tassa te suladdhaṁ,
root_text.dn16:4.42.6: yassa te tathāgato pacchimaṁ piṇḍapātaṁ paribhuñjitvā parinibbuto.
root_text.dn16:4.42.7: Sammukhā metaṁ, āvuso cunda, bhagavato sutaṁ sammukhā paṭiggahitaṁ:
root_text.dn16:4.42.8: dveme piṇḍapātā samasamaphalā samavipākā, ativiya aññehi piṇḍapātehi mahapphalatarā ca mahānisaṁsatarā ca.
root_text.dn16:4.42.10: Yañca piṇḍapātaṁ paribhuñjitvā tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambujjhati, yañca piṇḍapātaṁ paribhuñjitvā tathāgato anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbāyati.
root_text.dn16:4.42.11: Ime dve piṇḍapātā samasamaphalā samavipākā, ativiya aññehi piṇḍapātehi mahapphalatarā ca mahānisaṁsatarā ca.
root_text.dn16:4.42.12: Āyusaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, vaṇṇasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, sukhasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, yasasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, saggasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitaṁ, ādhipateyyasaṁvattanikaṁ āyasmatā cundena kammāraputtena kammaṁ upacitan’ti.
root_text.dn16:4.42.13: Cundassa, ānanda, kammāraputtassa evaṁ vippaṭisāro paṭivinetabbo”ti.
root_text.dn16:4.43.1: Atha kho bhagavā etamatthaṁ viditvā tāyaṁ velāyaṁ imaṁ udānaṁ udānesi:
root_text.dn16:5.1.1: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn16:5.1.2: “āyāmānanda, yena hiraññavatiyā nadiyā pārimaṁ tīraṁ, yena kusinārā upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ tenupasaṅkamissāmā”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.1.3: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
root_text.dn16:5.1.4: Atha kho bhagavā mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ yena hiraññavatiyā nadiyā pārimaṁ tīraṁ, yena kusinārā upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ tenupasaṅkami. upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn16:5.1.5: “iṅgha me tvaṁ, ānanda, antarena yamakasālānaṁ uttarasīsakaṁ mañcakaṁ paññapehi, kilantosmi, ānanda, nipajjissāmī”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.1.6: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā antarena yamakasālānaṁ uttarasīsakaṁ mañcakaṁ paññapesi.
root_text.dn16:5.1.7: Atha kho bhagavā dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṁ kappesi pāde pādaṁ accādhāya sato sampajāno.
root_text.dn16:5.2.1: Tena kho pana samayena yamakasālā sabbaphāliphullā honti akālapupphehi.
root_text.dn16:5.2.2: Te tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
root_text.dn16:5.2.3: Dibbānipi mandāravapupphāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
root_text.dn16:5.2.4: Dibbānipi candanacuṇṇāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
root_text.dn16:5.2.5: Dibbānipi tūriyāni antalikkhe vajjanti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
root_text.dn16:5.2.6: Dibbānipi saṅgītāni antalikkhe vattanti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
root_text.dn16:5.3.1: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn16:5.3.3: Te tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
root_text.dn16:5.3.4: Dibbānipi mandāravapupphāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
root_text.dn16:5.3.5: Dibbānipi candanacuṇṇāni antalikkhā papatanti, tāni tathāgatassa sarīraṁ okiranti ajjhokiranti abhippakiranti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
root_text.dn16:5.3.6: Dibbānipi tūriyāni antalikkhe vajjanti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
root_text.dn16:5.3.7: Dibbānipi saṅgītāni antalikkhe vattanti tathāgatassa pūjāya.
root_text.dn16:5.3.8: Na kho, ānanda, ettāvatā tathāgato sakkato vā hoti garukato vā mānito vā pūjito vā apacito vā.
root_text.dn16:5.3.9: Yo kho, ānanda, bhikkhu vā bhikkhunī vā upāsako vā upāsikā vā dhammānudhammappaṭipanno viharati sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tathāgataṁ sakkaroti garuṁ karoti māneti pūjeti apaciyati, paramāya pūjāya.
root_text.dn16:5.4.1: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā upavāṇo bhagavato purato ṭhito hoti bhagavantaṁ bījayamāno.
root_text.dn16:5.4.2: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāresi:
root_text.dn16:5.4.5: “ayaṁ kho āyasmā upavāṇo dīgharattaṁ bhagavato upaṭṭhāko santikāvacaro samīpacārī.
root_text.dn16:5.4.6: Atha ca pana bhagavā pacchime kāle āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāreti:
root_text.dn16:5.4.8: Ko nu kho hetu, ko paccayo, yaṁ bhagavā āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāreti:
root_text.dn16:5.5.1: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:5.5.2: “ayaṁ, bhante, āyasmā upavāṇo dīgharattaṁ bhagavato upaṭṭhāko santikāvacaro samīpacārī.
root_text.dn16:5.5.3: Atha ca pana bhagavā pacchime kāle āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāreti:
root_text.dn16:5.5.5: Ko nu kho, bhante, hetu, ko paccayo, yaṁ bhagavā āyasmantaṁ upavāṇaṁ apasāreti:
root_text.dn16:5.5.7: “Yebhuyyena, ānanda, dasasu lokadhātūsu devatā sannipatitā tathāgataṁ dassanāya.
root_text.dn16:5.5.8: Yāvatā, ānanda, kusinārā upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ samantato dvādasa yojanāni, natthi so padeso vālaggakoṭinittudanamattopi mahesakkhāhi devatāhi apphuṭo.
root_text.dn16:5.5.11: Kadāci karahaci tathāgatā loke uppajjanti arahanto sammāsambuddhā.
root_text.dn16:5.5.12: Ajjeva rattiyā pacchime yāme tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
root_text.dn16:5.5.13: Ayañca mahesakkho bhikkhu bhagavato purato ṭhito ovārento, na mayaṁ labhāma pacchime kāle tathāgataṁ dassanāyā’”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.6.2: “Santānanda, devatā ākāse pathavīsaññiniyo kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
root_text.dn16:5.6.3: ‘atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antaradhāyissatī’ti.
root_text.dn16:5.6.4: Santānanda, devatā pathaviyaṁ pathavīsaññiniyo kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
root_text.dn16:5.6.5: ‘atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antaradhāyissatī’ti.
root_text.dn16:5.6.6: Yā pana tā devatā vītarāgā, tā satā sampajānā adhivāsenti:
root_text.dn16:5.7.1: “Pubbe, bhante, disāsu vassaṁvuṭṭhā bhikkhū āgacchanti tathāgataṁ dassanāya.
root_text.dn16:5.7.2: Te mayaṁ labhāma manobhāvanīye bhikkhū dassanāya, labhāma payirupāsanāya.
root_text.dn16:5.7.3: Bhagavato pana mayaṁ, bhante, accayena na labhissāma manobhāvanīye bhikkhū dassanāya, na labhissāma payirupāsanāyā”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.8.1: “Cattārimāni, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyāni saṁvejanīyāni ṭhānāni.
root_text.dn16:5.8.3: ‘Idha tathāgato jāto’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
root_text.dn16:5.8.4: ‘Idha tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
root_text.dn16:5.8.5: ‘Idha tathāgatena anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavattitan’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
root_text.dn16:5.8.6: ‘Idha tathāgato anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbuto’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
root_text.dn16:5.8.7: Imāni kho, ānanda, cattāri saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyāni saṁvejanīyāni ṭhānāni.
root_text.dn16:5.8.8: Āgamissanti kho, ānanda, saddhā bhikkhū bhikkhuniyo upāsakā upāsikāyo:
root_text.dn16:5.8.9: ‘idha tathāgato jāto’tipi, ‘idha tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’tipi, ‘idha tathāgatena anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavattitan’tipi, ‘idha tathāgato anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbuto’tipi.
root_text.dn16:5.8.10: Ye hi keci, ānanda, cetiyacārikaṁ āhiṇḍantā pasannacittā kālaṁ karissanti, sabbe te kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjissantī”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.10.3: Iṅgha tumhe, ānanda, sāratthe ghaṭatha anuyuñjatha, sāratthe appamattā ātāpino pahitattā viharatha.
root_text.dn16:5.10.4: Santānanda, khattiyapaṇḍitāpi brāhmaṇapaṇḍitāpi gahapatipaṇḍitāpi tathāgate abhippasannā, te tathāgatassa sarīrapūjaṁ karissantī”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.11.2: “Yathā kho, ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti, evaṁ tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabban”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.11.3: “Kathaṁ pana, bhante, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjantī”ti?
root_text.dn16:5.11.4: “Rañño, ānanda, cakkavattissa sarīraṁ ahatena vatthena veṭhenti, ahatena vatthena veṭhetvā vihatena kappāsena veṭhenti, vihatena kappāsena veṭhetvā ahatena vatthena veṭhenti.
root_text.dn16:5.11.5: Etenupāyena pañcahi yugasatehi rañño cakkavattissa sarīraṁ veṭhetvā āyasāya teladoṇiyā pakkhipitvā aññissā āyasāya doṇiyā paṭikujjitvā sabbagandhānaṁ citakaṁ karitvā rañño cakkavattissa sarīraṁ jhāpenti.
root_text.dn16:5.11.7: Evaṁ kho, ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti.
root_text.dn16:5.11.8: Yathā kho, ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti, evaṁ tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabbaṁ.
root_text.dn16:5.11.10: Tattha ye mālaṁ vā gandhaṁ vā cuṇṇakaṁ vā āropessanti vā abhivādessanti vā cittaṁ vā pasādessanti tesaṁ taṁ bhavissati dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāya.
root_text.dn16:5.12.3: Tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho, paccekasambuddho thūpāraho, tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho, rājā cakkavattī thūpārahoti.
root_text.dn16:5.12.4: Kiñcānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho?
root_text.dn16:5.12.5: ‘Ayaṁ tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
root_text.dn16:5.12.6: Te tattha cittaṁ pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
root_text.dn16:5.12.7: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca tathāgato arahaṁ sammāsambuddho thūpāraho.
root_text.dn16:5.12.9: ‘Ayaṁ tassa bhagavato paccekasambuddhassa thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
root_text.dn16:5.12.10: Te tattha cittaṁ pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
root_text.dn16:5.12.11: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca paccekasambuddho thūpāraho.
root_text.dn16:5.12.12: Kiñcānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho?
root_text.dn16:5.12.13: ‘Ayaṁ tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa sāvakassa thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
root_text.dn16:5.12.14: Te tattha cittaṁ pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
root_text.dn16:5.12.15: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca tathāgatassa sāvako thūpāraho.
root_text.dn16:5.12.16: Kiñcānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho?
root_text.dn16:5.12.17: ‘Ayaṁ tassa dhammikassa dhammarañño thūpo’ti, ānanda, bahujanā cittaṁ pasādenti.
root_text.dn16:5.12.18: Te tattha cittaṁ pasādetvā kāyassa bhedā paraṁ maraṇā sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjanti.
root_text.dn16:5.12.19: Idaṁ kho, ānanda, atthavasaṁ paṭicca rājā cakkavattī thūpāraho.
root_text.dn16:5.13.1: Atha kho āyasmā ānando vihāraṁ pavisitvā kapisīsaṁ ālambitvā rodamāno aṭṭhāsi:
root_text.dn16:5.13.2: “ahañca vatamhi sekho sakaraṇīyo, satthu ca me parinibbānaṁ bhavissati, yo mama anukampako”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.13.5: “Eso, bhante, āyasmā ānando vihāraṁ pavisitvā kapisīsaṁ ālambitvā rodamāno ṭhito:
root_text.dn16:5.13.6: ‘ahañca vatamhi sekho sakaraṇīyo, satthu ca me parinibbānaṁ bhavissati, yo mama anukampako’”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.13.7: Atha kho bhagavā aññataraṁ bhikkhuṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn16:5.13.8: “ehi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, mama vacanena ānandaṁ āmantehi:
root_text.dn16:5.13.10: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho so bhikkhu bhagavato paṭissutvā yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:5.14.1: “Evamāvuso”ti kho āyasmā ānando tassa bhikkhuno paṭissutvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ bhagavā etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:5.14.2: “alaṁ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi, nanu etaṁ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacceva akkhātaṁ:
root_text.dn16:5.14.4: taṁ kutettha, ānanda, labbhā. Yaṁ taṁ jātaṁ bhūtaṁ saṅkhataṁ palokadhammaṁ, ‘taṁ vata tathāgatassāpi sarīraṁ mā palujjī’ti netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
root_text.dn16:5.14.5: Dīgharattaṁ kho te, ānanda, tathāgato paccupaṭṭhito mettena kāyakammena hitena sukhena advayena appamāṇena, mettena vacīkammena hitena sukhena advayena appamāṇena, mettena manokammena hitena sukhena advayena appamāṇena.
root_text.dn16:5.14.6: Katapuññosi tvaṁ, ānanda, padhānamanuyuñja, khippaṁ hohisi anāsavo”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.15.2: “yepi te, bhikkhave, ahesuṁ atītamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, tesampi bhagavantānaṁ etapparamāyeva upaṭṭhākā ahesuṁ, seyyathāpi mayhaṁ ānando.
root_text.dn16:5.15.3: Yepi te, bhikkhave, bhavissanti anāgatamaddhānaṁ arahanto sammāsambuddhā, tesampi bhagavantānaṁ etapparamāyeva upaṭṭhākā bhavissanti, seyyathāpi mayhaṁ ānando.
root_text.dn16:5.15.6: Jānāti ‘ayaṁ kālo tathāgataṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamituṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, ayaṁ kālo bhikkhunīnaṁ, ayaṁ kālo upāsakānaṁ, ayaṁ kālo upāsikānaṁ, ayaṁ kālo rañño rājamahāmattānaṁ titthiyānaṁ titthiyasāvakānan’ti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.1: Cattārome, bhikkhave, acchariyā abbhutā dhammā ānande.
root_text.dn16:5.16.3: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.4: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.5: Atittāva, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā hoti, atha kho ānando tuṇhī hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.6: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.7: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.8: Atittāva, bhikkhave, bhikkhunīparisā hoti, atha kho ānando tuṇhī hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.9: Sace, bhikkhave, upāsakaparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.10: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.11: Atittāva, bhikkhave, upāsakaparisā hoti, atha kho ānando tuṇhī hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.12: Sace, bhikkhave, upāsikāparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.13: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.14: Atittāva, bhikkhave, upāsikāparisā hoti, atha kho ānando tuṇhī hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.15: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā ānande.
root_text.dn16:5.16.16: Cattārome, bhikkhave, acchariyā abbhutā dhammā raññe cakkavattimhi.
root_text.dn16:5.16.18: Sace, bhikkhave, khattiyaparisā rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.19: Tatra ce rājā cakkavattī bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.20: Atittāva, bhikkhave, khattiyaparisā hoti. Atha kho rājā cakkavattī tuṇhī hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.23: samaṇaparisā rājānaṁ cakkavattiṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.24: Tatra ce rājā cakkavattī bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.25: Atittāva, bhikkhave, samaṇaparisā hoti. Atha kho rājā cakkavattī tuṇhī hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.26: Evameva kho, bhikkhave, cattārome acchariyā abbhutā dhammā ānande.
root_text.dn16:5.16.27: Sace, bhikkhave, bhikkhuparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.28: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.33: upāsikāparisā ānandaṁ dassanāya upasaṅkamati, dassanena sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.34: Tatra ce ānando dhammaṁ bhāsati, bhāsitenapi sā attamanā hoti.
root_text.dn16:5.16.37: Ime kho, bhikkhave, cattāro acchariyā abbhutā dhammā ānande”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.17.1: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:5.17.2: “mā, bhante, bhagavā imasmiṁ khuddakanagarake ujjaṅgalanagarake sākhānagarake parinibbāyi.
root_text.dn16:5.17.4: campā rājagahaṁ sāvatthī sāketaṁ kosambī bārāṇasī;
root_text.dn16:5.17.6: Ettha bahū khattiyamahāsālā, brāhmaṇamahāsālā gahapatimahāsālā tathāgate abhippasannā.
root_text.dn16:5.17.8: “mā hevaṁ, ānanda, avaca, mā hevaṁ, ānanda, avaca:
root_text.dn16:5.18.1: Bhūtapubbaṁ, ānanda, rājā mahāsudassano nāma ahosi cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
root_text.dn16:5.18.2: Rañño, ānanda, mahāsudassanassa ayaṁ kusinārā kusāvatī nāma rājadhānī ahosi.
root_text.dn16:5.18.3: puratthimena ca pacchimena ca dvādasayojanāni āyāmena; uttarena ca dakkhiṇena ca sattayojanāni vitthārena.
root_text.dn16:5.18.4: Kusāvatī, ānanda, rājadhānī iddhā ceva ahosi phītā ca bahujanā ca ākiṇṇamanussā ca subhikkhā ca.
root_text.dn16:5.18.5: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, devānaṁ āḷakamandā nāma rājadhānī iddhā ceva hoti phītā ca bahujanā ca ākiṇṇayakkhā ca subhikkhā ca;
root_text.dn16:5.18.6: evameva kho, ānanda, kusāvatī rājadhānī iddhā ceva ahosi phītā ca bahujanā ca ākiṇṇamanussā ca subhikkhā ca.
root_text.dn16:5.18.7: Kusāvatī, ānanda, rājadhānī dasahi saddehi avivittā ahosi divā ceva rattiñca, seyyathidaṁ—
root_text.dn16:5.18.8: hatthisaddena assasaddena rathasaddena bherisaddena mudiṅgasaddena vīṇāsaddena gītasaddena saṅkhasaddena sammasaddena pāṇitāḷasaddena ‘asnātha pivatha khādathā’ti dasamena saddena.
root_text.dn16:5.19.1: Gaccha tvaṁ, ānanda, kusināraṁ pavisitvā kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ ārocehi:
root_text.dn16:5.19.2: ‘ajja kho, vāseṭṭhā, rattiyā pacchime yāme tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
root_text.dn16:5.19.5: amhākañca no gāmakkhette tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ ahosi, na mayaṁ labhimhā pacchime kāle tathāgataṁ dassanāyā’”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.19.6: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paṭissutvā nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya attadutiyo kusināraṁ pāvisi.
root_text.dn16:5.20.1: Tena kho pana samayena kosinārakā mallā sandhāgāre sannipatitā honti kenacideva karaṇīyena.
root_text.dn16:5.20.2: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ sandhāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ ārocesi:
root_text.dn16:5.20.3: “ajja kho, vāseṭṭhā, rattiyā pacchime yāme tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
root_text.dn16:5.20.6: ‘amhākañca no gāmakkhette tathāgatassa parinibbānaṁ ahosi, na mayaṁ labhimhā pacchime kāle tathāgataṁ dassanāyā’”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.21.1: Idamāyasmato ānandassa vacanaṁ sutvā mallā ca mallaputtā ca mallasuṇisā ca mallapajāpatiyo ca aghāvino dummanā cetodukkhasamappitā appekacce kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti vivaṭṭanti:
root_text.dn16:5.21.2: “atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbāyissati, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antaradhāyissatī”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.21.3: Atha kho mallā ca mallaputtā ca mallasuṇisā ca mallapajāpatiyo ca aghāvino dummanā cetodukkhasamappitā yena upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkamiṁsu.
root_text.dn16:5.22.2: “sace kho ahaṁ kosinārake malle ekamekaṁ bhagavantaṁ vandāpessāmi, avandito bhagavā kosinārakehi mallehi bhavissati, athāyaṁ ratti vibhāyissati.
root_text.dn16:5.22.3: Yannūnāhaṁ kosinārake malle kulaparivattaso kulaparivattaso ṭhapetvā bhagavantaṁ vandāpeyyaṁ:
root_text.dn16:5.22.4: ‘itthannāmo, bhante, mallo saputto sabhariyo sapariso sāmacco bhagavato pāde sirasā vandatī’”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.22.5: Atha kho āyasmā ānando kosinārake malle kulaparivattaso kulaparivattaso ṭhapetvā bhagavantaṁ vandāpesi:
root_text.dn16:5.22.6: “itthannāmo, bhante, mallo saputto sabhariyo sapariso sāmacco bhagavato pāde sirasā vandatī”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.22.7: Atha kho āyasmā ānando etena upāyena paṭhameneva yāmena kosinārake malle bhagavantaṁ vandāpesi.
root_text.dn16:5.23.1: Tena kho pana samayena subhaddo nāma paribbājako kusinārāyaṁ paṭivasati.
root_text.dn16:5.23.3: “ajja kira rattiyā pacchime yāme samaṇassa gotamassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissatī”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.23.5: “sutaṁ kho pana metaṁ paribbājakānaṁ vuḍḍhānaṁ mahallakānaṁ ācariyapācariyānaṁ bhāsamānānaṁ:
root_text.dn16:5.23.6: ‘kadāci karahaci tathāgatā loke uppajjanti arahanto sammāsambuddhā’ti.
root_text.dn16:5.23.7: Ajjeva rattiyā pacchime yāme samaṇassa gotamassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
root_text.dn16:5.23.8: Atthi ca me ayaṁ kaṅkhādhammo uppanno,
root_text.dn16:5.23.9: evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ samaṇe gotame, ‘pahoti me samaṇo gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ, yathāhaṁ imaṁ kaṅkhādhammaṁ pajaheyyan’”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.24.1: Atha kho subhaddo paribbājako yena upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ, yenāyasmā ānando tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:5.24.2: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bho ānanda, paribbājakānaṁ vuḍḍhānaṁ mahallakānaṁ ācariyapācariyānaṁ bhāsamānānaṁ:
root_text.dn16:5.24.3: ‘kadāci karahaci tathāgatā loke uppajjanti arahanto sammāsambuddhā’ti.
root_text.dn16:5.24.4: Ajjeva rattiyā pacchime yāme samaṇassa gotamassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
root_text.dn16:5.24.5: Atthi ca me ayaṁ kaṅkhādhammo uppanno—
root_text.dn16:5.24.6: evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ samaṇe gotame ‘pahoti me samaṇo gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ, yathāhaṁ imaṁ kaṅkhādhammaṁ pajaheyyan’ti.
root_text.dn16:5.24.7: Sādhāhaṁ, bho ānanda, labheyyaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāyā”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.24.8: Evaṁ vutte, āyasmā ānando subhaddaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:5.24.9: “alaṁ, āvuso subhadda, mā tathāgataṁ viheṭhesi, kilanto bhagavā”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.24.11: tatiyampi kho subhaddo paribbājako āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:5.24.12: “sutaṁ metaṁ, bho ānanda, paribbājakānaṁ vuḍḍhānaṁ mahallakānaṁ ācariyapācariyānaṁ bhāsamānānaṁ:
root_text.dn16:5.24.13: ‘kadāci karahaci tathāgatā loke uppajjanti arahanto sammāsambuddhā’ti.
root_text.dn16:5.24.14: Ajjeva rattiyā pacchime yāme samaṇassa gotamassa parinibbānaṁ bhavissati.
root_text.dn16:5.24.15: Atthi ca me ayaṁ kaṅkhādhammo uppanno—
root_text.dn16:5.24.16: evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ samaṇe gotame, ‘pahoti me samaṇo gotamo tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ, yathāhaṁ imaṁ kaṅkhādhammaṁ pajaheyyan’ti.
root_text.dn16:5.24.17: Sādhāhaṁ, bho ānanda, labheyyaṁ samaṇaṁ gotamaṁ dassanāyā”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.24.18: Tatiyampi kho āyasmā ānando subhaddaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:5.24.19: “alaṁ, āvuso subhadda, mā tathāgataṁ viheṭhesi, kilanto bhagavā”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.25.1: Assosi kho bhagavā āyasmato ānandassa subhaddena paribbājakena saddhiṁ imaṁ kathāsallāpaṁ.
root_text.dn16:5.25.2: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn16:5.25.3: “alaṁ, ānanda, mā subhaddaṁ vāresi, labhataṁ, ānanda, subhaddo tathāgataṁ dassanāya.
root_text.dn16:5.25.4: Yaṁ kiñci maṁ subhaddo pucchissati, sabbaṁ taṁ aññāpekkhova pucchissati, no vihesāpekkho.
root_text.dn16:5.25.5: Yañcassāhaṁ puṭṭho byākarissāmi, taṁ khippameva ājānissatī”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.25.6: Atha kho āyasmā ānando subhaddaṁ paribbājakaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:5.26.1: Atha kho subhaddo paribbājako yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavatā saddhiṁ sammodi, sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho subhaddo paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:5.26.2: “yeme, bho gotama, samaṇabrāhmaṇā saṅghino gaṇino gaṇācariyā ñātā yasassino titthakarā sādhusammatā bahujanassa,
root_text.dn16:5.26.3: seyyathidaṁ—pūraṇo kassapo, makkhali gosālo, ajito kesakambalo, pakudho kaccāyano, sañcayo belaṭṭhaputto, nigaṇṭho nāṭaputto,
root_text.dn16:5.26.4: sabbete sakāya paṭiññāya abbhaññiṁsu, sabbeva na abbhaññiṁsu, udāhu ekacce abbhaññiṁsu, ekacce na abbhaññiṁsū”ti?
root_text.dn16:5.26.6: ‘sabbete sakāya paṭiññāya abbhaññiṁsu, sabbeva na abbhaññiṁsu, udāhu ekacce abbhaññiṁsu, ekacce na abbhaññiṁsū’ti.
root_text.dn16:5.26.9: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho subhaddo paribbājako bhagavato paccassosi.
root_text.dn16:5.27.1: “Yasmiṁ kho, subhadda, dhammavinaye ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo na upalabbhati, samaṇopi tattha na upalabbhati. Dutiyopi tattha samaṇo na upalabbhati. Tatiyopi tattha samaṇo na upalabbhati. Catutthopi tattha samaṇo na upalabbhati.
root_text.dn16:5.27.2: Yasmiñca kho, subhadda, dhammavinaye ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo upalabbhati, samaṇopi tattha upalabbhati, dutiyopi tattha samaṇo upalabbhati, tatiyopi tattha samaṇo upalabbhati, catutthopi tattha samaṇo upalabbhati.
root_text.dn16:5.27.3: Imasmiṁ kho, subhadda, dhammavinaye ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo upalabbhati, idheva, subhadda, samaṇo, idha dutiyo samaṇo, idha tatiyo samaṇo, idha catuttho samaṇo, suññā parappavādā samaṇebhi aññehi.
root_text.dn16:5.27.4: Ime ca, subhadda, bhikkhū sammā vihareyyuṁ, asuñño loko arahantehi assāti.
root_text.dn16:5.27.15: Ime ca, subhadda, bhikkhū sammā vihareyyuṁ, asuñño loko arahantehi assā”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.28.1: Evaṁ vutte, subhaddo paribbājako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:5.28.3: Seyyathāpi, bhante, nikkujjitaṁ vā ukkujjeyya, paṭicchannaṁ vā vivareyya, mūḷhassa vā maggaṁ ācikkheyya, andhakāre vā telapajjotaṁ dhāreyya: ‘cakkhumanto rūpāni dakkhantī’ti; evamevaṁ bhagavatā anekapariyāyena dhammo pakāsito.
root_text.dn16:5.28.4: Esāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ saraṇaṁ gacchāmi dhammañca bhikkhusaṅghañca.
root_text.dn16:5.28.5: Labheyyāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, labheyyaṁ upasampadan”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.29.1: “Yo kho, subhadda, aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṁ, ākaṅkhati upasampadaṁ, so cattāro māse parivasati. Catunnaṁ māsānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājenti upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya.
root_text.dn16:5.29.3: “Sace, bhante, aññatitthiyapubbā imasmiṁ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhantā pabbajjaṁ ākaṅkhantā upasampadaṁ cattāro māse parivasanti, catunnaṁ māsānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājenti upasampādenti bhikkhubhāvāya. Ahaṁ cattāri vassāni parivasissāmi, catunnaṁ vassānaṁ accayena āraddhacittā bhikkhū pabbājentu upasampādentu bhikkhubhāvāyā”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.29.4: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn16:5.29.6: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato paccassosi.
root_text.dn16:5.30.1: Atha kho subhaddo paribbājako āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:5.30.2: “lābhā vo, āvuso ānanda; suladdhaṁ vo, āvuso ānanda,
root_text.dn16:5.30.3: ye ettha satthu sammukhā antevāsikābhisekena abhisittā”ti.
root_text.dn16:5.30.4: Alattha kho subhaddo paribbājako bhagavato santike pabbajjaṁ, alattha upasampadaṁ.
root_text.dn16:5.30.5: Acirūpasampanno kho panāyasmā subhaddo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahitatto viharanto nacirasseva—yassatthāya kulaputtā sammadeva agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajanti—tadanuttaraṁ brahmacariyapariyosānaṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.
root_text.dn16:5.30.6: “Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, kataṁ karaṇīyaṁ, nāparaṁ itthattāyā”ti abbhaññāsi.
root_text.dn16:5.30.7: Aññataro kho panāyasmā subhaddo arahataṁ ahosi.
root_text.dn16:6.1.1: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn16:6.1.4: Na kho panetaṁ, ānanda, evaṁ daṭṭhabbaṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.1.5: Yo vo, ānanda, mayā dhammo ca vinayo ca desito paññatto, so vo mamaccayena satthā.
root_text.dn16:6.2.1: Yathā kho panānanda, etarahi bhikkhū aññamaññaṁ āvusovādena samudācaranti, na kho mamaccayena evaṁ samudācaritabbaṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.2.2: Theratarena, ānanda, bhikkhunā navakataro bhikkhu nāmena vā gottena vā āvusovādena vā samudācaritabbo.
root_text.dn16:6.2.3: Navakatarena bhikkhunā therataro bhikkhu ‘bhante’ti vā ‘āyasmā’ti vā samudācaritabbo.
root_text.dn16:6.3.1: Ākaṅkhamāno, ānanda, saṅgho mamaccayena khuddānukhuddakāni sikkhāpadāni samūhanatu.
root_text.dn16:6.4.1: Channassa, ānanda, bhikkhuno mamaccayena brahmadaṇḍo dātabbo”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.4.3: “Channo, ānanda, bhikkhu yaṁ iccheyya, taṁ vadeyya.
root_text.dn16:6.4.4: So bhikkhūhi neva vattabbo, na ovaditabbo, na anusāsitabbo”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.5.2: “siyā kho pana, bhikkhave, ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā, pucchatha, bhikkhave, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha:
root_text.dn16:6.5.3: ‘sammukhībhūto no satthā ahosi, na mayaṁ sakkhimhā bhagavantaṁ sammukhā paṭipucchitun’”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.5.4: Evaṁ vutte, te bhikkhū tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.6.3: “siyā kho pana, bhikkhave, ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā, pucchatha, bhikkhave, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha:
root_text.dn16:6.6.4: ‘sammukhībhūto no satthā ahosi, na mayaṁ sakkhimhā bhagavantaṁ sammukhā paṭipucchitun’”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.6.5: Tatiyampi kho te bhikkhū tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.6.7: “siyā kho pana, bhikkhave, satthugāravenapi na puccheyyātha. Sahāyakopi, bhikkhave, sahāyakassa ārocetū”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.6.8: Evaṁ vutte, te bhikkhū tuṇhī ahesuṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.6.9: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:6.6.10: “acchariyaṁ, bhante, abbhutaṁ, bhante, evaṁ pasanno ahaṁ, bhante, imasmiṁ bhikkhusaṅghe, ‘natthi ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā’”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.6.11: “Pasādā kho tvaṁ, ānanda, vadesi, ñāṇameva hettha, ānanda, tathāgatassa. Natthi imasmiṁ bhikkhusaṅghe ekabhikkhussāpi kaṅkhā vā vimati vā buddhe vā dhamme vā saṅghe vā magge vā paṭipadāya vā.
root_text.dn16:6.6.12: Imesañhi, ānanda, pañcannaṁ bhikkhusatānaṁ yo pacchimako bhikkhu, so sotāpanno avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhiparāyaṇo”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.8.1: Atha kho bhagavā paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, paṭhamajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, dutiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, tatiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā catutthaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, catutthajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samāpajji, ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samāpajji, viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samāpajji, ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samāpajji, nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ samāpajji.
root_text.dn16:6.8.2: Atha kho āyasmā ānando āyasmantaṁ anuruddhaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:6.9.1: Atha kho bhagavā saññāvedayitanirodhasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samāpajji, nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samāpajji, ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samāpajji, viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samāpajji, ākāsānañcāyatanasamāpattiyā vuṭṭhahitvā catutthaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, catutthajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, tatiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, dutiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā paṭhamaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, paṭhamajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā dutiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, dutiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā tatiyaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, tatiyajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā catutthaṁ jhānaṁ samāpajji, catutthajjhānā vuṭṭhahitvā samanantarā bhagavā parinibbāyi.
root_text.dn16:6.10.1: Parinibbute bhagavati saha parinibbānā mahābhūmicālo ahosi bhiṁsanako salomahaṁso. Devadundubhiyo ca phaliṁsu.
root_text.dn16:6.10.2: Parinibbute bhagavati saha parinibbānā brahmāsahampati imaṁ gāthaṁ abhāsi:
root_text.dn16:6.10.9: Parinibbute bhagavati saha parinibbānā sakko devānamindo imaṁ gāthaṁ abhāsi:
root_text.dn16:6.10.14: Parinibbute bhagavati saha parinibbānā āyasmā anuruddho imā gāthāyo abhāsi:
root_text.dn16:6.10.23: Parinibbute bhagavati saha parinibbānā āyasmā ānando imaṁ gāthaṁ abhāsi:
root_text.dn16:6.10.28: Parinibbute bhagavati ye te tattha bhikkhū avītarāgā appekacce bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti vivaṭṭanti, “atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antarahito”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.10.29: Ye pana te bhikkhū vītarāgā, te satā sampajānā adhivāsenti:
root_text.dn16:6.11.1: Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho bhikkhū āmantesi:
root_text.dn16:6.11.3: Nanu etaṁ, āvuso, bhagavatā paṭikacceva akkhātaṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.11.5: Taṁ kutettha, āvuso, labbhā. ‘Yaṁ taṁ jātaṁ bhūtaṁ saṅkhataṁ palokadhammaṁ, taṁ vata mā palujjī’ti, netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjati.
root_text.dn16:6.11.7: “Kathaṁbhūtā pana, bhante, āyasmā anuruddho devatā manasi karotī”ti?
root_text.dn16:6.11.8: “Santāvuso ānanda, devatā ākāse pathavīsaññiniyo kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
root_text.dn16:6.11.9: ‘atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antarahito’ti.
root_text.dn16:6.11.10: Santāvuso ānanda, devatā pathaviyā pathavīsaññiniyo kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
root_text.dn16:6.11.11: ‘atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antarahito’ti.
root_text.dn16:6.11.12: Yā pana tā devatā vītarāgā, tā satā sampajānā adhivāsenti:
root_text.dn16:6.11.14: Atha kho āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca ānando taṁ rattāvasesaṁ dhammiyā kathāya vītināmesuṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.12.1: Atha kho āyasmā anuruddho āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ āmantesi:
root_text.dn16:6.12.2: “gacchāvuso ānanda, kusināraṁ pavisitvā kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ ārocehi:
root_text.dn16:6.12.5: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā ānando āyasmato anuruddhassa paṭissutvā pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya attadutiyo kusināraṁ pāvisi.
root_text.dn16:6.12.6: Tena kho pana samayena kosinārakā mallā sandhāgāre sannipatitā honti teneva karaṇīyena.
root_text.dn16:6.12.7: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ sandhāgāraṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ ārocesi:
root_text.dn16:6.12.10: Idamāyasmato ānandassa vacanaṁ sutvā mallā ca mallaputtā ca mallasuṇisā ca mallapajāpatiyo ca aghāvino dummanā cetodukkhasamappitā appekacce kese pakiriya kandanti, bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
root_text.dn16:6.12.11: “atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antarahito”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.13.1: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā purise āṇāpesuṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.13.2: “tena hi, bhaṇe, kusinārāyaṁ gandhamālañca sabbañca tāḷāvacaraṁ sannipātethā”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.13.3: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā gandhamālañca sabbañca tāḷāvacaraṁ pañca ca dussayugasatāni ādāya yena upavattanaṁ mallānaṁ sālavanaṁ, yena bhagavato sarīraṁ tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavato sarīraṁ naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkarontā garuṁ karontā mānentā pūjentā celavitānāni karontā maṇḍalamāḷe paṭiyādentā ekadivasaṁ vītināmesuṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.13.5: “ativikālo kho ajja bhagavato sarīraṁ jhāpetuṁ, sve dāni mayaṁ bhagavato sarīraṁ jhāpessāmā”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.13.6: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā bhagavato sarīraṁ naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkarontā garuṁ karontā mānentā pūjentā celavitānāni karontā maṇḍalamāḷe paṭiyādentā dutiyampi divasaṁ vītināmesuṁ, tatiyampi divasaṁ vītināmesuṁ, catutthampi divasaṁ vītināmesuṁ, pañcamampi divasaṁ vītināmesuṁ, chaṭṭhampi divasaṁ vītināmesuṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.14.1: Atha kho sattamaṁ divasaṁ kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ etadahosi:
root_text.dn16:6.14.2: “mayaṁ bhagavato sarīraṁ naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkarontā garuṁ karontā mānentā pūjentā dakkhiṇena dakkhiṇaṁ nagarassa haritvā bāhirena bāhiraṁ dakkhiṇato nagarassa bhagavato sarīraṁ jhāpessāmā”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.14.3: Tena kho pana samayena aṭṭha mallapāmokkhā sīsaṁnhātā ahatāni vatthāni nivatthā:
root_text.dn16:6.14.4: “mayaṁ bhagavato sarīraṁ uccāressāmā”ti na sakkonti uccāretuṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.14.5: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā āyasmantaṁ anuruddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.14.6: “ko nu kho, bhante anuruddha, hetu ko paccayo, yenime aṭṭha mallapāmokkhā sīsaṁnhātā ahatāni vatthāni nivatthā:
root_text.dn16:6.14.7: ‘mayaṁ bhagavato sarīraṁ uccāressāmā’ti na sakkonti uccāretun”ti?
root_text.dn16:6.14.8: “Aññathā kho, vāseṭṭhā, tumhākaṁ adhippāyo, aññathā devatānaṁ adhippāyo”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.15.3: ‘mayaṁ bhagavato sarīraṁ naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkarontā garuṁ karontā mānentā pūjentā dakkhiṇena dakkhiṇaṁ nagarassa haritvā bāhirena bāhiraṁ dakkhiṇato nagarassa bhagavato sarīraṁ jhāpessāmā’ti;
root_text.dn16:6.15.5: ‘mayaṁ bhagavato sarīraṁ dibbehi naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkarontā garuṁ karontā mānentā pūjentā uttarena uttaraṁ nagarassa haritvā uttarena dvārena nagaraṁ pavesetvā majjhena majjhaṁ nagarassa haritvā puratthimena dvārena nikkhamitvā puratthimato nagarassa makuṭabandhanaṁ nāma mallānaṁ cetiyaṁ ettha bhagavato sarīraṁ jhāpessāmā’”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.16.1: Tena kho pana samayena kusinārā yāva sandhisamalasaṅkaṭīrā jaṇṇumattena odhinā mandāravapupphehi santhatā hoti.
root_text.dn16:6.16.2: Atha kho devatā ca kosinārakā ca mallā bhagavato sarīraṁ dibbehi ca mānusakehi ca naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkarontā garuṁ karontā mānentā pūjentā uttarena uttaraṁ nagarassa haritvā uttarena dvārena nagaraṁ pavesetvā majjhena majjhaṁ nagarassa haritvā puratthimena dvārena nikkhamitvā puratthimato nagarassa makuṭabandhanaṁ nāma mallānaṁ cetiyaṁ ettha ca bhagavato sarīraṁ nikkhipiṁsu.
root_text.dn16:6.17.1: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā āyasmantaṁ ānandaṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.17.2: “kathaṁ mayaṁ, bhante ānanda, tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjāmā”ti?
root_text.dn16:6.17.3: “Yathā kho, vāseṭṭhā, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti, evaṁ tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabban”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.17.4: “Kathaṁ pana, bhante ānanda, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjantī”ti?
root_text.dn16:6.17.5: “Rañño, vāseṭṭhā, cakkavattissa sarīraṁ ahatena vatthena veṭhenti, ahatena vatthena veṭhetvā vihatena kappāsena veṭhenti, vihatena kappāsena veṭhetvā ahatena vatthena veṭhenti.
root_text.dn16:6.17.6: Etena upāyena pañcahi yugasatehi rañño cakkavattissa sarīraṁ veṭhetvā āyasāya teladoṇiyā pakkhipitvā aññissā āyasāya doṇiyā paṭikujjitvā sabbagandhānaṁ citakaṁ karitvā rañño cakkavattissa sarīraṁ jhāpenti.
root_text.dn16:6.17.8: Evaṁ kho, vāseṭṭhā, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti.
root_text.dn16:6.17.9: Yathā kho, vāseṭṭhā, rañño cakkavattissa sarīre paṭipajjanti, evaṁ tathāgatassa sarīre paṭipajjitabbaṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.17.11: Tattha ye mālaṁ vā gandhaṁ vā cuṇṇakaṁ vā āropessanti vā abhivādessanti vā cittaṁ vā pasādessanti, tesaṁ taṁ bhavissati dīgharattaṁ hitāya sukhāyā”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.18.1: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā purise āṇāpesuṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.18.2: “tena hi, bhaṇe, mallānaṁ vihataṁ kappāsaṁ sannipātethā”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.18.3: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā bhagavato sarīraṁ ahatena vatthena veṭhetvā vihatena kappāsena veṭhesuṁ, vihatena kappāsena veṭhetvā ahatena vatthena veṭhesuṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.18.4: Etena upāyena pañcahi yugasatehi bhagavato sarīraṁ veṭhetvā āyasāya teladoṇiyā pakkhipitvā aññissā āyasāya doṇiyā paṭikujjitvā sabbagandhānaṁ citakaṁ karitvā bhagavato sarīraṁ citakaṁ āropesuṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.19.1: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā mahākassapo pāvāya kusināraṁ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.
root_text.dn16:6.19.2: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo maggā okkamma aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle nisīdi.
root_text.dn16:6.19.3: Tena kho pana samayena aññataro ājīvako kusinārāya mandāravapupphaṁ gahetvā pāvaṁ addhānamaggappaṭipanno hoti.
root_text.dn16:6.19.4: Addasā kho āyasmā mahākassapo taṁ ājīvakaṁ dūratova āgacchantaṁ, disvā taṁ ājīvakaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:6.19.8: Tattha ye te bhikkhū avītarāgā appekacce bāhā paggayha kandanti, chinnapātaṁ papatanti, āvaṭṭanti, vivaṭṭanti:
root_text.dn16:6.19.9: “atikhippaṁ bhagavā parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ sugato parinibbuto, atikhippaṁ cakkhuṁ loke antarahito”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.19.10: Ye pana te bhikkhū vītarāgā, te satā sampajānā adhivāsenti:
root_text.dn16:6.20.1: Tena kho pana samayena subhaddo nāma vuddhapabbajito tassaṁ parisāyaṁ nisinno hoti.
root_text.dn16:6.20.2: Atha kho subhaddo vuddhapabbajito te bhikkhū etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:6.20.3: “alaṁ, āvuso, mā socittha, mā paridevittha, sumuttā mayaṁ tena mahāsamaṇena. Upaddutā ca homa:
root_text.dn16:6.20.4: ‘idaṁ vo kappati, idaṁ vo na kappatī’ti.
root_text.dn16:6.20.5: Idāni pana mayaṁ yaṁ icchissāma, taṁ karissāma, yaṁ na icchissāma, na taṁ karissāmā”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.20.6: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo bhikkhū āmantesi:
root_text.dn16:6.20.8: Nanu etaṁ, āvuso, bhagavatā paṭikacceva akkhātaṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.20.10: Taṁ kutettha, āvuso, labbhā. ‘Yaṁ taṁ jātaṁ bhūtaṁ saṅkhataṁ palokadhammaṁ, taṁ tathāgatassāpi sarīraṁ mā palujjī’ti, netaṁ ṭhānaṁ vijjatī”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.21.1: Tena kho pana samayena cattāro mallapāmokkhā sīsaṁnhātā ahatāni vatthāni nivatthā:
root_text.dn16:6.21.2: “mayaṁ bhagavato citakaṁ āḷimpessāmā”ti na sakkonti āḷimpetuṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.21.3: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā āyasmantaṁ anuruddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.21.4: “ko nu kho, bhante anuruddha, hetu ko paccayo, yenime cattāro mallapāmokkhā sīsaṁnhātā ahatāni vatthāni nivatthā:
root_text.dn16:6.21.5: ‘mayaṁ bhagavato citakaṁ āḷimpessāmā’ti na sakkonti āḷimpetun”ti?
root_text.dn16:6.21.9: ‘ayaṁ āyasmā mahākassapo pāvāya kusināraṁ addhānamaggappaṭipanno mahatā bhikkhusaṅghena saddhiṁ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi.
root_text.dn16:6.21.10: Na tāva bhagavato citako pajjalissati, yāvāyasmā mahākassapo bhagavato pāde sirasā na vandissatī’”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.22.1: Atha kho āyasmā mahākassapo yena kusinārā makuṭabandhanaṁ nāma mallānaṁ cetiyaṁ, yena bhagavato citako tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekaṁsaṁ cīvaraṁ katvā añjaliṁ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṁ citakaṁ padakkhiṇaṁ katvā bhagavato pāde sirasā vandi.
root_text.dn16:6.22.2: Tānipi kho pañcabhikkhusatāni ekaṁsaṁ cīvaraṁ katvā añjaliṁ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṁ citakaṁ padakkhiṇaṁ katvā bhagavato pāde sirasā vandiṁsu.
root_text.dn16:6.22.3: Vandite ca panāyasmatā mahākassapena tehi ca pañcahi bhikkhusatehi sayameva bhagavato citako pajjali.
root_text.dn16:6.23.1: Jhāyamānassa kho pana bhagavato sarīrassa yaṁ ahosi chavīti vā cammanti vā maṁsanti vā nhārūti vā lasikāti vā, tassa neva chārikā paññāyittha, na masi;
root_text.dn16:6.23.3: Seyyathāpi nāma sappissa vā telassa vā jhāyamānassa neva chārikā paññāyati, na masi;
root_text.dn16:6.23.4: evameva bhagavato sarīrassa jhāyamānassa yaṁ ahosi chavīti vā cammanti vā maṁsanti vā nhārūti vā lasikāti vā, tassa neva chārikā paññāyittha, na masi;
root_text.dn16:6.23.6: Tesañca pañcannaṁ dussayugasatānaṁ dveva dussāni na ḍayhiṁsu yañca sabbaabbhantarimaṁ yañca bāhiraṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.23.7: Daḍḍhe ca kho pana bhagavato sarīre antalikkhā udakadhārā pātubhavitvā bhagavato citakaṁ nibbāpesi.
root_text.dn16:6.23.9: Kosinārakāpi mallā sabbagandhodakena bhagavato citakaṁ nibbāpesuṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.23.10: Atha kho kosinārakā mallā bhagavato sarīrāni sattāhaṁ sandhāgāre sattipañjaraṁ karitvā dhanupākāraṁ parikkhipāpetvā naccehi gītehi vāditehi mālehi gandhehi sakkariṁsu garuṁ kariṁsu mānesuṁ pūjesuṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.24.1: Assosi kho rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto:
root_text.dn16:6.24.3: Atha kho rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ dūtaṁ pāhesi:
root_text.dn16:6.24.4: “bhagavāpi khattiyo ahampi khattiyo, ahampi arahāmi bhagavato sarīrānaṁ bhāgaṁ, ahampi bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca karissāmī”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.24.7: Atha kho vesālikā licchavī kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ dūtaṁ pāhesuṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.24.8: “bhagavāpi khattiyo mayampi khattiyā, mayampi arahāma bhagavato sarīrānaṁ bhāgaṁ, mayampi bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca karissāmā”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.24.11: Atha kho kapilavatthuvāsī sakyā kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ dūtaṁ pāhesuṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.24.12: “bhagavā amhākaṁ ñātiseṭṭho, mayampi arahāma bhagavato sarīrānaṁ bhāgaṁ, mayampi bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca karissāmā”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.24.15: Atha kho allakappakā bulayo kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ dūtaṁ pāhesuṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.24.16: “bhagavāpi khattiyo mayampi khattiyā, mayampi arahāma bhagavato sarīrānaṁ bhāgaṁ, mayampi bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca karissāmā”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.24.19: Atha kho rāmagāmakā koḷiyā kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ dūtaṁ pāhesuṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.24.20: “bhagavāpi khattiyo mayampi khattiyā, mayampi arahāma bhagavato sarīrānaṁ bhāgaṁ, mayampi bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca karissāmā”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.24.23: Atha kho veṭṭhadīpako brāhmaṇo kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ dūtaṁ pāhesi:
root_text.dn16:6.24.24: “bhagavāpi khattiyo ahampismi brāhmaṇo, ahampi arahāmi bhagavato sarīrānaṁ bhāgaṁ, ahampi bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca karissāmī”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.24.27: Atha kho pāveyyakā mallā kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ dūtaṁ pāhesuṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.24.28: “bhagavāpi khattiyo mayampi khattiyā, mayampi arahāma bhagavato sarīrānaṁ bhāgaṁ, mayampi bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca karissāmā”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.25.1: Evaṁ vutte, kosinārakā mallā te saṅghe gaṇe etadavocuṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.25.2: “bhagavā amhākaṁ gāmakkhette parinibbuto, na mayaṁ dassāma bhagavato sarīrānaṁ bhāgan”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.25.3: Evaṁ vutte, doṇo brāhmaṇo te saṅghe gaṇe etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:6.25.12: “Tena hi, brāhmaṇa, tvaññeva bhagavato sarīrāni aṭṭhadhā samaṁ savibhattaṁ vibhajāhī”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.25.13: “Evaṁ, bho”ti kho doṇo brāhmaṇo tesaṁ saṅghānaṁ gaṇānaṁ paṭissutvā bhagavato sarīrāni aṭṭhadhā samaṁ suvibhattaṁ vibhajitvā te saṅghe gaṇe etadavoca:
root_text.dn16:6.25.14: “imaṁ me bhonto tumbaṁ dadantu ahampi tumbassa thūpañca mahañca karissāmī”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.25.15: Adaṁsu kho te doṇassa brāhmaṇassa tumbaṁ.
root_text.dn16:6.26.3: Atha kho pippalivaniyā moriyā kosinārakānaṁ mallānaṁ dūtaṁ pāhesuṁ:
root_text.dn16:6.26.4: “bhagavāpi khattiyo mayampi khattiyā, mayampi arahāma bhagavato sarīrānaṁ bhāgaṁ, mayampi bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca karissāmā”ti.
root_text.dn16:6.26.5: “Natthi bhagavato sarīrānaṁ bhāgo, vibhattāni bhagavato sarīrāni.
root_text.dn16:6.27.1: Atha kho rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto rājagahe bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca akāsi.
root_text.dn16:6.27.2: Vesālikāpi licchavī vesāliyaṁ bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca akaṁsu.
root_text.dn16:6.27.3: Kapilavatthuvāsīpi sakyā kapilavatthusmiṁ bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca akaṁsu.
root_text.dn16:6.27.4: Allakappakāpi bulayo allakappe bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca akaṁsu.
root_text.dn16:6.27.5: Rāmagāmakāpi koḷiyā rāmagāme bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca akaṁsu.
root_text.dn16:6.27.6: Veṭṭhadīpakopi brāhmaṇo veṭṭhadīpe bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca akāsi.
root_text.dn16:6.27.7: Pāveyyakāpi mallā pāvāyaṁ bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca akaṁsu.
root_text.dn16:6.27.8: Kosinārakāpi mallā kusinārāyaṁ bhagavato sarīrānaṁ thūpañca mahañca akaṁsu.
root_text.dn16:6.27.9: Doṇopi brāhmaṇo tumbassa thūpañca mahañca akāsi.
root_text.dn16:6.27.10: Pippalivaniyāpi moriyā pippalivane aṅgārānaṁ thūpañca mahañca akaṁsu.
root_text.dn16:6.27.11: Iti aṭṭha sarīrathūpā navamo tumbathūpo dasamo aṅgārathūpo.

translation_text.dn16:0.2: The Great Discourse on the Buddha’s Extinguishment
translation_text.dn16:1.1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
translation_text.dn16:1.1.3: Now at that time King Ajātasattu of Magadha, son of the princess of Videha, wanted to invade the Vajjis.
translation_text.dn16:1.1.5: “I shall wipe out these Vajjis, so mighty and powerful! I shall destroy them, and lay ruin and devastation upon them!”
translation_text.dn16:1.2.1: And then King Ajātasattu addressed Vassakāra the brahmin minister of Magadha,
translation_text.dn16:1.2.2: “Please, brahmin, go to the Buddha, and in my name bow with your head to his feet. Ask him if he is healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.
translation_text.dn16:1.2.5: ‘Sir, King Ajātasattu of Magadha, son of the princess of Videha, wants to invade the Vajjis.
translation_text.dn16:1.2.7: “I shall wipe out these Vajjis, so mighty and powerful! I shall destroy them, and lay ruin and devastation upon them!”’
translation_text.dn16:1.2.8: Remember well how the Buddha answers and tell it to me.
translation_text.dn16:1.2.9: For Realized Ones say nothing that is not so.”
translation_text.dn16:1.3.1: “Yes, worthy sir,” Vassakāra replied. He had the finest carriages harnessed. Then he mounted a fine carriage and, along with other fine carriages, set out from Rājagaha for the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.
translation_text.dn16:1.3.2: He went by carriage as far as the terrain allowed, then descended and approached the Buddha on foot, and exchanged greetings with him.
translation_text.dn16:1.3.3: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side and said to the Buddha,
translation_text.dn16:1.3.4: “Worthy Gotama, King Ajātasattu of Magadha, son of the princess of Videha, bows with his head to your feet. He asks if you are healthy and well, nimble, strong, and living comfortably.
translation_text.dn16:1.3.5: Worthy Gotama, King Ajātasattu wants to invade the Vajjis.
translation_text.dn16:1.3.7: ‘I shall wipe out these Vajjis, so mighty and powerful! I shall destroy them, and lay ruin and devastation upon them!’”
translation_text.dn16:1.4.1: Now at that time Venerable Ānanda was standing behind the Buddha fanning him.
translation_text.dn16:1.4.2: Then the Buddha said to him,
translation_text.dn16:1.4.3: “Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis meet frequently and have many meetings?”
translation_text.dn16:1.4.5: “As long as the Vajjis meet frequently and have many meetings, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.4.6: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony?”
translation_text.dn16:1.4.8: “As long as the Vajjis meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.4.9: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but proceed having undertaken the ancient Vajjian traditions as they have been decreed?”
translation_text.dn16:1.4.11: “As long as the Vajjis don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but proceed having undertaken the ancient Vajjian traditions as they have been decreed, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.4.12: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate Vajjian elders, and think them worth listening to?”
translation_text.dn16:1.4.14: “As long as the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate Vajjian elders, and think them worth listening to, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.4.15: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis don’t forcibly abduct the women or girls of the clans and make them live with them?”
translation_text.dn16:1.4.17: “As long as the Vajjis don’t forcibly abduct the women or girls of the clans and make them live with them, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.4.18: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjian shrines, whether inner or outer, not neglecting the proper spirit-offerings that were given and made in the past?”
translation_text.dn16:1.4.20: “As long as the Vajjis honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the Vajjian shrines, whether inner or outer, not neglecting the proper spirit-offerings that were given and made in the past, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.4.21: Ānanda, have you heard that the Vajjis organize proper protection, shelter, and security for perfected ones, so that more perfected ones might come to the realm and those already here may live in comfort?”
translation_text.dn16:1.4.23: “As long as the Vajjis organize proper protection, shelter, and security for perfected ones, so that more perfected ones might come to the realm and those already here may live in comfort, they can expect growth, not decline.”
translation_text.dn16:1.5.1: Then the Buddha said to Vassakāra,
translation_text.dn16:1.5.2: “Brahmin, this one time I was staying near Vesālī at the Sārandada Shrine.
translation_text.dn16:1.5.3: There I taught the Vajjis these seven principles that prevent decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.5.4: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the Vajjis, and as long as the Vajjis are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.”
translation_text.dn16:1.5.5: When the Buddha had spoken, Vassakāra said to him,
translation_text.dn16:1.5.6: “Worthy Gotama, if the Vajjis follow even a single one of these principles they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.5.7: How much more so all seven!
translation_text.dn16:1.5.8: King Ajātasattu cannot defeat the Vajjis in war, unless by bribery or by sowing dissension.
translation_text.dn16:1.5.9: Well, now, worthy Gotama, I must go. I have many duties, and much to do.”
translation_text.dn16:1.5.11: Then Vassakāra the brahmin, having approved and agreed with what the Buddha said, got up from his seat and left.
translation_text.dn16:1.6.0: 3. Principles That Prevent Decline Among the Mendicants
translation_text.dn16:1.6.1: Soon after he had left, the Buddha said to Ānanda,
translation_text.dn16:1.6.2: “Go, Ānanda, gather all the mendicants staying in the vicinity of Rājagaha together in the assembly hall.”
translation_text.dn16:1.6.3: “Yes, sir,” replied Ānanda. He did what the Buddha asked. Then he went back, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,
translation_text.dn16:1.6.4: “Sir, the mendicant Saṅgha has assembled. Please, sir, go at your convenience.”
translation_text.dn16:1.6.5: Then the Buddha went to the assembly hall, where he sat on the seat spread out
translation_text.dn16:1.6.7: “Mendicants, I will teach you these seven principles that prevent decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.6.8: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”
translation_text.dn16:1.6.11: “As long as the mendicants meet frequently and have many meetings, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.6.12: As long as the mendicants meet in harmony, leave in harmony, and carry on their business in harmony, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.6.13: As long as the mendicants don’t make new decrees or abolish existing decrees, but undertake and follow the training rules as they have been decreed, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.6.14: As long as the mendicants honor, respect, esteem, and venerate the senior mendicants—of long standing, long gone forth, fathers and leaders of the Saṅgha—and think them worth listening to, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.6.15: As long as the mendicants don’t fall under the sway of arisen craving for future lives, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.6.16: As long as the mendicants take care to live in wilderness lodgings, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.6.17: As long as the mendicants individually establish mindfulness, so that more good-hearted spiritual companions might come, and those that have already come may live comfortably, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.6.18: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.7.1: I will teach you seven more principles that prevent decline. …
translation_text.dn16:1.7.4: As long as the mendicants don’t relish work, loving it and liking to relish it, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.7.5: As long as they don’t relish talk …
translation_text.dn16:1.7.8: they don’t have corrupt wishes, falling under the sway of corrupt wishes …
translation_text.dn16:1.7.9: they don’t have bad friends, companions, and associates …
translation_text.dn16:1.7.10: they don’t stop half-way after achieving some trifling distinction, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.8.1: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.8.2: I will teach you seven more principles that prevent decline. …
translation_text.dn16:1.8.3: As long as the mendicants are faithful …
translation_text.dn16:1.8.9: wise, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.8.10: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.8.11: I will teach you seven more principles that prevent decline. …
translation_text.dn16:1.9.1: As long as the mendicants develop the awakening factors of mindfulness …
translation_text.dn16:1.9.7: equanimity, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.10.1: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.10.2: I will teach you seven more principles that prevent decline. …
translation_text.dn16:1.10.5: As long as the mendicants develop the perceptions of impermanence …
translation_text.dn16:1.10.11: cessation, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.10.12: As long as these seven principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.11.1: I will teach you six principles that prevent decline. …
translation_text.dn16:1.11.4: As long as the mendicants consistently treat their spiritual companions with bodily kindness …
translation_text.dn16:1.11.6: and mental kindness both in public and in private, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.11.7: As long as the mendicants share without reservation any material things they have gained by legitimate means, even the food placed in the alms-bowl, using them in common with their ethical spiritual companions, they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.11.8: As long as the mendicants live according to the precepts shared with their spiritual companions, both in public and in private—such precepts as are intact, impeccable, spotless, and unmarred, liberating, praised by sensible people, not mistaken, and leading to immersion—they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.11.9: As long as the mendicants live according to the view shared with their spiritual companions, both in public and in private—the view that is noble and emancipating, and delivers one who practices it to the complete end of suffering—they can expect growth, not decline.
translation_text.dn16:1.11.10: As long as these six principles that prevent decline last among the mendicants, and as long as the mendicants are seen following them, they can expect growth, not decline.”
translation_text.dn16:1.12.1: And while staying there at the Vulture’s Peak the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:
translation_text.dn16:1.12.2: “Such is ethics, such is immersion, such is wisdom.
translation_text.dn16:1.12.3: When immersion is imbued with ethics it’s very fruitful and beneficial.
translation_text.dn16:1.12.4: When wisdom is imbued with immersion it’s very fruitful and beneficial.
translation_text.dn16:1.12.5: When the mind is imbued with wisdom it is rightly freed from the defilements, namely,
translation_text.dn16:1.12.6: the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.”
translation_text.dn16:1.13.1: When the Buddha had stayed in Rājagaha as long as he pleased, he addressed Venerable Ānanda,
translation_text.dn16:1.13.4: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at Ambalaṭṭhikā,
translation_text.dn16:1.14.1: where he stayed in the royal rest-house.
translation_text.dn16:1.14.2: And while staying there, too, he often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:
translation_text.dn16:1.14.3: “Such is ethics, such is immersion, such is wisdom.
translation_text.dn16:1.14.4: When immersion is imbued with ethics it’s very fruitful and beneficial.
translation_text.dn16:1.14.5: When wisdom is imbued with immersion it’s very fruitful and beneficial.
translation_text.dn16:1.14.6: When the mind is imbued with wisdom it is rightly freed from the defilements, namely,
translation_text.dn16:1.14.7: the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.”
translation_text.dn16:1.15.1: When the Buddha had stayed in Ambalaṭṭhikā as long as he pleased, he addressed Venerable Ānanda,
translation_text.dn16:1.15.4: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at Nāḷandā,
translation_text.dn16:1.15.5: where he stayed in Pāvārika’s mango grove.
translation_text.dn16:1.16.1: Then Sāriputta went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,
translation_text.dn16:1.16.2: “Sir, I have such confidence in the Buddha that
translation_text.dn16:1.16.3: I believe there’s no other ascetic or brahmin—whether past, future, or present—whose direct knowledge is superior to the Buddha when it comes to awakening.”
translation_text.dn16:1.16.4: “That’s a grand and bold statement, Sāriputta. You’ve roared a definitive, categorical lion’s roar, saying:
translation_text.dn16:1.16.5: ‘I have such confidence in the Buddha that
translation_text.dn16:1.16.6: I believe there’s no other ascetic or brahmin—whether past, future, or present—whose direct knowledge is superior to the Buddha when it comes to awakening.’
translation_text.dn16:1.16.7: What about all the perfected ones, the fully awakened Buddhas who lived in the past? Have you encompassed their minds to know that
translation_text.dn16:1.16.8: those Buddhas had such ethics, or such qualities, or such wisdom, or such meditation, or such freedom?”
translation_text.dn16:1.16.10: “And what about all the perfected ones, the fully awakened Buddhas who will live in the future? Have you encompassed their minds to know that
translation_text.dn16:1.16.11: those Buddhas will have such ethics, or such qualities, or such wisdom, or such meditation, or such freedom?”
translation_text.dn16:1.16.13: “And what about me, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha at present? Have you encompassed my mind to know that
translation_text.dn16:1.16.14: I have such ethics, or such qualities, or such wisdom, or such meditation, or such freedom?”
translation_text.dn16:1.16.16: “In that case, Sāriputta, given that you don’t encompass the minds of Buddhas past, future, or present,
translation_text.dn16:1.16.17: what then are you doing, making such a grand and bold statement, roaring such a definitive, categorical lion’s roar?”
translation_text.dn16:1.17.1: “Sir, though I don’t encompass the minds of Buddhas past, future, and present,
translation_text.dn16:1.17.2: still I understand this by inference from the teaching.
translation_text.dn16:1.17.3: Suppose there was a king’s frontier citadel with fortified embankments, ramparts, and arches, and a single gate.
translation_text.dn16:1.17.4: And it has a gatekeeper who is astute, competent, and intelligent. He keeps strangers out and lets known people in.
translation_text.dn16:1.17.5: As he walks around the patrol path, he doesn’t see a hole or cleft in the wall, not even one big enough for a cat to slip out.
translation_text.dn16:1.17.7: ‘Whatever sizable creatures enter or leave the citadel, all of them do so via this gate.’
translation_text.dn16:1.17.8: In the same way, I understand this by inference from the teaching:
translation_text.dn16:1.17.9: ‘All the perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas—whether past, future, or present—give up the five hindrances, corruptions of the heart that weaken wisdom. Their mind is firmly established in the four kinds of mindfulness meditation. They correctly develop the seven awakening factors. And they awaken to the supreme perfect awakening.’”
translation_text.dn16:1.18.1: And while staying at Nāḷandā, too, the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:
translation_text.dn16:1.18.2: “Such is ethics, such is immersion, such is wisdom.
translation_text.dn16:1.18.3: When immersion is imbued with ethics it’s very fruitful and beneficial.
translation_text.dn16:1.18.4: When wisdom is imbued with immersion it’s very fruitful and beneficial.
translation_text.dn16:1.18.5: When the mind is imbued with wisdom it is rightly freed from the defilements, namely,
translation_text.dn16:1.18.6: the defilements of sensuality, desire to be reborn, and ignorance.”
translation_text.dn16:1.19.1: When the Buddha had stayed in Nāḷandā as long as he pleased, he addressed Venerable Ānanda,
translation_text.dn16:1.19.2: “Come, Ānanda, let’s go to Pāṭali Village.”
translation_text.dn16:1.19.4: Then the Buddha together with a large Saṅgha of mendicants arrived at Pāṭali Village.
translation_text.dn16:1.20.1: The lay followers of Pāṭali Village heard that he had arrived.
translation_text.dn16:1.20.2: So they went to see him, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,
translation_text.dn16:1.20.3: “Sir, please consent to come to our guest house.”
translation_text.dn16:1.21.1: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, the lay followers of Pāṭali Village got up from their seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on their right. Then they went to the guest house, where they spread carpets all over, prepared seats, set up a water jar, and placed an oil lamp. Then they went back to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and told him of their preparations, saying:
translation_text.dn16:1.22.1: In the morning, the Buddha robed up and, taking his bowl and robe, went to the guest house together with the Saṅgha of mendicants. Having washed his feet he entered the guest house and sat against the central column facing east.
translation_text.dn16:1.22.2: The Saṅgha of mendicants also washed their feet, entered the guest house, and sat against the west wall facing east, with the Buddha right in front of them.
translation_text.dn16:1.22.3: The lay followers of Pāṭali Village also washed their feet, entered the guest house, and sat against the east wall facing west, with the Buddha right in front of them.
translation_text.dn16:1.23.2: “Householders, there are these five drawbacks for an unethical person because of their failure in ethics.
translation_text.dn16:1.23.4: Firstly, an unethical person loses great wealth on account of negligence.
translation_text.dn16:1.23.5: This is the first drawback for an unethical person because of their failure in ethics.
translation_text.dn16:1.23.6: Furthermore, an unethical person gets a bad reputation.
translation_text.dn16:1.23.8: Furthermore, an unethical person enters any kind of assembly timid and embarrassed, whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.
translation_text.dn16:1.23.10: Furthermore, an unethical person feels lost when they die.
translation_text.dn16:1.23.12: Furthermore, an unethical person, when their body breaks up, after death, is reborn in a place of loss, a bad place, the underworld, hell.
translation_text.dn16:1.23.14: These are the five drawbacks for an unethical person because of their failure in ethics.
translation_text.dn16:1.24.1: There are these five benefits for an ethical person because of their accomplishment in ethics.
translation_text.dn16:1.24.3: Firstly, an ethical person gains great wealth on account of diligence.
translation_text.dn16:1.24.5: Furthermore, an ethical person gets a good reputation.
translation_text.dn16:1.24.7: Furthermore, an ethical person enters any kind of assembly bold and self-assured, whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.
translation_text.dn16:1.24.9: Furthermore, an ethical person dies not feeling lost.
translation_text.dn16:1.24.11: Furthermore, when an ethical person’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
translation_text.dn16:1.24.13: These are the five benefits for an ethical person because of their accomplishment in ethics.”
translation_text.dn16:1.25.1: The Buddha spent much of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the lay followers of Pāṭali Village with a Dhamma talk. Then he sent them off,
translation_text.dn16:1.25.2: “The night is getting late, householders. Please go at your convenience.”
translation_text.dn16:1.25.3: “Yes, sir,” replied the lay followers of Pāṭali Village. They got up from their seat, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on their right, before leaving.
translation_text.dn16:1.25.4: Soon after they left the Buddha entered a private cubicle.
translation_text.dn16:1.26.1: Now at that time the Magadhan ministers Sunidha and Vassakāra were building a citadel at Pāṭali Village to keep the Vajjis out.
translation_text.dn16:1.26.2: At that time thousands of deities were taking possession of building sites in Pāṭali Village.
translation_text.dn16:1.26.3: Illustrious rulers or royal ministers inclined to build houses at sites possessed by illustrious deities.
translation_text.dn16:1.27.1: Middling rulers or royal ministers inclined to build houses at sites possessed by middling deities.
translation_text.dn16:1.27.2: Lesser rulers or royal ministers inclined to build houses at sites possessed by lesser deities.
translation_text.dn16:1.27.3: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, the Buddha saw those deities taking possession of building sites in Pāṭali Village.
translation_text.dn16:1.27.4: The Buddha rose at the crack of dawn and addressed Ānanda,
translation_text.dn16:1.27.5: “Ānanda, who is building a citadel at Pāṭali Village?”
translation_text.dn16:1.27.6: “Sir, the Magadhan ministers Sunidha and Vassakāra are building a citadel to keep the Vajjis out.”
translation_text.dn16:1.28.1: “It’s as if they were building the citadel in consultation with the gods of the thirty-three.
translation_text.dn16:1.28.3: With clairvoyance that is purified and superhuman, I saw those deities taking possession of building sites.
translation_text.dn16:1.28.4: Illustrious rulers or royal ministers inclined to build houses at sites possessed by illustrious deities.
translation_text.dn16:1.28.5: Middling rulers or royal ministers inclined to build houses at sites possessed by middling deities.
translation_text.dn16:1.28.6: Lesser rulers or royal ministers inclined to build houses at sites possessed by lesser deities.
translation_text.dn16:1.28.7: As far as the civilized region extends, as far as the trading zone extends, this will be the chief city: the Pāṭaliputta trade center.
translation_text.dn16:1.28.8: But Pāṭaliputta will face three threats:
translation_text.dn16:1.29.1: Then the Magadhan ministers Sunidha and Vassakāra approached the Buddha, and exchanged greetings with him.
translation_text.dn16:1.29.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they stood to one side and said,
translation_text.dn16:1.29.3: “Would the worthy Gotama together with the mendicant Saṅgha please accept today’s meal from me?”
translation_text.dn16:1.30.1: Then, knowing that the Buddha had consented, they went to their own guest house, where they had delicious fresh and cooked foods prepared. Then they had the Buddha informed of the time, saying,
translation_text.dn16:1.30.2: “It’s time, worthy Gotama, the meal is ready.”
translation_text.dn16:1.30.3: Then the Buddha robed up in the morning and, taking his bowl and robe, went to their guest house together with the mendicant Saṅgha, where he sat on the seat spread out.
translation_text.dn16:1.30.4: Then Sunidha and Vassakāra served and satisfied the mendicant Saṅgha headed by the Buddha with their own hands with delicious fresh and cooked foods.
translation_text.dn16:1.30.5: When the Buddha had eaten and washed his hand and bowl, Sunidha and Vassakāra took a low seat and sat to one side.
translation_text.dn16:1.31.1: The Buddha expressed his appreciation with these verses:
translation_text.dn16:1.31.2: “In the place he makes his dwelling,
translation_text.dn16:1.31.10: After that they have sympathy for him,
translation_text.dn16:1.31.11: like a mother for the child at her breast.
translation_text.dn16:1.31.12: A man beloved of the deities
